posts.post_content:
This card *almost* makes me want to start playing competitively again...  
My favorite color is white. For years I have lobbied that MonoWhite does NOT equal white weenie (an archetype that I despise for its monotony!), but fits the bill of mid-range. For white should be able to do anything... maybe not everything ***well***, like counterspelling for instance (I feel that W should only EVER get soft counters that do things like [force spike](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=force spike), [mana leak](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=mana leak), [memory lapse](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=memory lapse), and ***MAYBE***, though it would have to be a rare or something, [remand](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=remand). Since it doesn't *REALLY* counter a spell outright... just stalls it.)... but white can pretty much do everything all the other colors can, with the exception of drawing cards outside of cantrips. And with the release of decent white removal again (though, like lightning bolt, I find Path to Exile on the side of "too powerful"), here's look... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

posts.post_content:
Queen, white should not be able to do "anything," as you put it. Really, white is mostly about defense, meaning lifegain, control, and soldiers (particularly ones that are good at blocking.) This is okay control, but its rules text implies something black, green, or red, not white. White is not a compendium of all colors, if you want that, run a 5-color deck (try Maelstrom or maybe Scarecrows, even though I hear the latter isn't great, and I haven't seen many people try their hand at Maelstrom.) Seriously, if white WAS a compendium of all the other colors, what is the point of making colorless cards? And the backs of the cards would have to depict a square with white in the middle and the other four colors at the corners. And everyone would be running white in their deck, which would make me split off and make my OWN game.  
Anyways, I agree about M10s flavor. Its slapstick, shallow, and not very witty (which is true for pretty much ALL of M10 in general, not just its flavor). The art fo... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
